website_summaries.verdict: Donning a casually rugged aesthetic, the Keen Citizen Keen Waterproof shoe is packed with features that make it an ideal footwear choice for people who love spontaneity and adventure. Its durable and waterproof construction coupled with a metatomical footbed provides the comfort of a sneaker with the function of a work cleat that could take you from the urban streets to the countryside.
pros: Most users prefer the Keen Citizen Keen Waterproof for its versatility in function and style
The shoe is available in some neutral colors that make for easy pairing with a myriad of outfits
Some reviewers commend the pair's excellent grip, especially on slippery surfaces
A significant number of reviewers like its style and design
The pair's materials and craftsmanship are considered to be of superior quality
A handful of wearers claim that the shoe provides adequate arch support
It is very comfortable and ideal for all-day wear, according to the majority of shoe users
This sneaker from KEEN is sturdy and durable, based on most consumers' opinions
Some commenters say it is quite lightweight
cons: A significant number of wearers complain about the shoe’s excessively long shoelaces
A few share that the colors of the pair in photos are not accurate

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof & poor traction
customer_reviews.text: They seemed nice and sturdy but they are not waterproof and have terrible traction. I wore them on a short, easy hike. Just splashing in shallow puddles was enough to get my feet wet (there seemed to be some leaking at the toe) and I almost slipped several times on very easy terrain. These might be OK for walking shoes, but certainly not for hiking
customer_reviews.author: boilermaker2001

customer_reviews.title: Don't seem to fit like other keen shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way these shoes look - unfortunately after wearing outside for a few hours I realized they don't seem to fit as other Keen shoes and I started noticing more pain than I would like in casual shoes. They seem to be constructed well, but due to being sized different than other keen shoes, I'm taking too stars away. My recommendation is to try on to make sure they work for you before buying/wearing out too long to return
customer_reviews.author: Mojy Wojy

customer_reviews.title: First time unhappy with Keens !
customer_reviews.text: Tried 2 pairs of these and had the same problem ? Weird bump under the left side of my left foot on both pairs ? Called Keen told them I have owned 10 different pairs of Keens over the years and have never had this issue, they had me pull the insoles out of one of my older pairs and replace them inside these to see if problem went away...it didn't so I sent them back and I'm trying a different brand for the first time in 5 years !
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size bigger than normal, and these still felt a little tight at first. I freaked a little, because I wanted to wear them during my trip to Europe, and I was leaving the same day. I took a gamble, and fortunately they broke in. They were pretty comfortable after that, and I did a LOT of walking (sometimes over 20,000 steps a day). They still feel just a little like they're pinching the sides of my toe tips, which is irritating, but they don't cause pain or blisters. I should probably have kept looking for something wide width. I'm pleased they are waterproof, and look good for a variety of occasions. Good choice for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: SIZE....
customer_reviews.text: The shoe it self is great. Normally I take a size 10. When I order on line I will order a 10.5 because my right foot is a little larger and again this usually works out fine. However the 10.5 was very tight, I don't believe it was even close. I like the shoe and is just what I wanted for fall and early winter. Very rugged and nice looking. I re-order a half size bigger and hope this will do it. So if you order these shoes you might want to go at least a half size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Love em'
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased these from Amazon. The picture is so you can see how they break in, as well as the color. At first these felt different than previous Keens I've worn and I was a bit worried at first. But once broken in, & I added good orthotic w/arch support and I've never owned better shoes for daily bicycle commuting in the PNW, and I still get compliments. I had to get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Ups and downs, but a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot and this is very firm. But it's stylish for a waterproof shoe. The laces were crazy long, so I chopped them off, burnt the end with a match and put heatshrink tape on the end. The heatshrink came off, but the melted end is still holding. The soles don't have a lot of padding, so I can feel the sole pattern through in the shoes, although not enough to send them back at all.
customer_reviews.author: John McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: The other reviewers noting how small this shoe is are entirely correct. I've worn an 8.5, or 9 D width all of my life. I ordered a 9, and 9.5, and the 9.5 is hitting my toes. Really strange sizing. Good looking shoe, but both are going back, and I'm afraid even the 10 would be too small. Never had a size 10 shoe in my life, and then the 10.5 at $120 per pair is too much to pay. Great looking shoe. Really hip even for old guys like me but the design is pretty flawed so I'm going to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size larger that recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I originally order a size 11.5 (US), but they were too small in the toe area. Amazon came through very quickly with the next size up, and they fit very well. So I would say that if you are interested in this shoe, consider ordering one half size larger. As for the quality of these shoes, you can't go wrong with Keen. The quality. looks, and sturdiness is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Borum

customer_reviews.title: Leather Will Stretch
customer_reviews.text: I am wary about buying shoes without having the opportunity to try them on first. These fit perfectly for me. Leather will stretch and so they may have been slightly too tight at first, they are now my go to shoe. I will be ordering 2 more pairs soon. The price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Burroughs Anderson

customer_reviews.title: way too small!!
customer_reviews.text: a nice shoe but WAY TOO SMALL - not even close the a 12 which I wear all the time. I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: DWGroucho

customer_reviews.title: They are good shoes, but run a touch small compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: They are good shoes, but run a touch small compared to other keens. If I had known, I would have gone up a half size for a great fit. While the color in the pics is reddish brown, they are more brown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ran small. Bumpy right sole
customer_reviews.text: Look very good. As the expectations were. My subjective opinion. Run small. I wear 45. Ordered 46 they are still small. Another problem a bump in the middle of the right sole. Will take then to sandalier to lengthen and replace the problematic sole for less massive to make more room inside. Disappointed. Expectations were more for keen and for the price
customer_reviews.author: yosef shaft

customer_reviews.title: Great idea/design, poor final product.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were not just too small, they were ridiculously too small. My 8.5's felt like 7.5's. Physically, they were at least a good inch shorter than any other size 8.5 Keen boot I own. Also, the shoelaces they came with were so long they could have fit 9" boots easily! Very strange. I guess they could have been mismarked in the manufacturing process but what does that say for their quality controls? I've always liked Keens but ordering this pair has made me a little gun-shy for future orders. The good news is that returning them was easy, thanks to Amazon's customer care.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Keen shoe quality is unparalleled. Keen shoe sizing is ...
customer_reviews.text: Keen shoe quality is unparalleled. Keen shoe sizing is just non-sensical. I used to buy size 9 Saltzmans and they fit perfectly. Last year I bought size 9.5 boulders and they were way too big. So I ordered size 9 and size 10 of these Citizens. Both were way too small. I guess I have to get a size 11 to get the right fit? I have no idea who is making sizing decisions at this company.
customer_reviews.author: R. Caulk

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes , but order a size or two larger they run very small
customer_reviews.text: I love keen shoes to work in. But their sizing is never consistent. The different styles are completely different in sizing . I have one pair in 9 and one pair in 9.5. These Keen Citizen Low WP run VERY small and I had to get a 10.5 when I normally wear a size 9. But I love the shoes. Once you get the right size they are comfortable, have good support and are waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Dara Dobson

customer_reviews.title: which did fit my toes just fine, but the extra half size made the shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the half size up as suggested, which did fit my toes just fine, but the extra half size made the shoe too wide. And the toe area is a different shape than most shoes. The shoe looked great. The insole was not comfortable. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Punchman

customer_reviews.title: Great all-purpose shoe especially when the weather gets wet and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great all-purpose shoe especially when the weather gets wet and sloppy. Bought two sizes up and although it's slightly bigger than ideal, I'm having no problems and issues with the fit. Of course, I do NOT plan on doing any serious hiking with these shoes so the extra room isn't really an issue. Has been exactly what I wanted for wearing around town running errands or wearing to work on days following the blizzard. Has also kept my feet warm throughout the record cold we've just had in the northeast. Soles can get slippery in packed snow and ice.
customer_reviews.author: Saf

customer_reviews.title: Keen has been my favorite shoe for years
customer_reviews.text: Keen has been my favorite shoe for years. No problems. However, these shoes are too small, and have poor arch support. The soles are too soft. The last set of eyelets for the laces seems to be too far from the end of the tongue. As a result my feet slide even farther toward the already too tight-fitting end of the shoe when I walk. I intend to follow up with Keen directly to see what they have to say.
customer_reviews.author: JHA/MLA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with purchase. Had tried the Austin in a store but purchased this one because it was on sale, thinking it would fit similar to the Austin, but nope. Been wearing it for 2 weeks now... Does not have a much support, feels smaller, not very comfortable - feels somewhat like a cheap skater shoes from W-mart. For shoes that costs almost as much as the Austin, I should have bought the Austin.
customer_reviews.author: MI

customer_reviews.title: KEEN, you screwed up this shoe
customer_reviews.text: KEEN, you screwed up this shoe. It's a great looking shoe. The fit is smaller than usual for Keen but still fine for my foot. The deal killer is the footbed. No support. No real padding of any kind. You can take this shoe and fold it completely in half at the arch. That may work for some but don't buy this shoe expecting the classic KEEN fit and feel.
customer_reviews.author: tlinn-com

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expect from Keen comfort wise
customer_reviews.text: I have to first admit, I currently have 5 pairs of Keen shoes. I love them, and wear them pretty much all the time. Style wise, I liked these as a casual jeans wearing shoe. Something was way off with the footbed / sole. It felt really concaved and really weren't very comfortable. I returned these for a pair of Boston 3 which are VERY comfortable and look even better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Hammey

customer_reviews.title: Great travel shoe
customer_reviews.text: I use these as travel shoes because I wanted something that would be versatile/durable without looking too obviously like an outdoor shoe. I've been very pleased overall. I find them comfortable, they're roomy inside but fit me well. They're a little heavy and bulky, but I feel like my feet are very well protected, and so far they're showing no wear after lots of walking through various terrain (cities, hiking, beach/ocean, etc.) Waterproofing seems to work well - of course if you go in over your ankles, they'll overtop, but great for small creeks and city puddles.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: getting narrow, needed new laces
customer_reviews.text: width is much narrower than the used to be. Come on, Keen, that's why I'm buying from you! Shoes came with laces that were obscenely long, looked like clown shoes. Had to shell out more money for new laces.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P

customer_reviews.title: I have a lot of Keen shoes and and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of Keen shoes and and I ALWAYS get a size 8, when I read the other reviews they said they run small so I bought a size 8.5.they too were too small. Returning those also for a size 9. I’ll let you know if those work
customer_reviews.author: Renee B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, went 1/2 size larger
customer_reviews.text: These are are comfortable. I bought a 1/2 size large than what I usually buy from New Balance in a SL- 2;last; e.g,. the NB 857 v3. and they fit fine. I have a bunion on my right foot and it does have enough room in the toe box. The toe box though does not seem very large (like other KEEN shoes), but I guess large enough for me. The only compliant that I have is that the shoe laces are way too long, almost dangerously long. I am going to contact KEEN to see if I can get shorter laces that match.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nestor

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike I only hope keen dont stop making them u don't have to break them in just put on and wear this was my 3rd pair
customer_reviews.author: TRACY H.

customer_reviews.title: Buy a half size larger than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: Although I am happy with these it's really hard to give them a thorough review because they're just too small. I have worn the same size shoe for 30 years so I thought I knew what size I needed. I hiked with them a day to see if they'd loosen up enough to suit but it was clear that it wasn't going to happen. So don't give up on them but try to find a place to try them on before buying online. I wasn't able to find them locally.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Thoms

customer_reviews.title: Really nice shoe. Only complaint is the shoe strings were ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice shoe. Only complaint is the shoe strings were too long. I had to order new laces as the ones with the shoe are 55 inches and Ieven after double tying laces were still very long. I replaced with 45 inch pair of laces. Too bad I had to buy new laces for new shoes.
customer_reviews.author: sr

customer_reviews.title: ... buy Keen shoes all the time and they fit great. This shoe did not
customer_reviews.text: I buy Keen shoes all the time and they fit great. This shoe did not, way too small for the size 10 they say it is. more like a 9 maybe a 9.5 if I stay off my feet, which then this would probably be a good shoe. But I kind of like to walk and this shoe becomes impossible to wear. Sorry Keen you blew it on this one, will have to return the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tully

customer_reviews.title: Citizen Low - B+
customer_reviews.text: I had to return my initial purchase of a size 9.5 pair that was too small. I reordered a pair of size 10s, but they're a tad bit too big. I still really enjoy these shoes so far but only time will tell how they hold up. For right now, they look good and feel good. I will be swapping out the insoles for something a bit more comfortable for my weird feet though.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Well made with good materials. Thin sole.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe! Well made. This sole is a little thin for me so I tried to put insoles in them but it made the shoe too uncomfortable (put pressure on one of my toes) so I took them out. I'll wait a couple months or so for the shoes to break in and try the insoles again. Other than that I like them.
customer_reviews.author: ShawnyeWest

customer_reviews.title: Fit just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Fit just as expected. I wear a size 10 in every shoe I've ever bought. This is my first pair of keens. I don't have the fitment issues others have spoke about. They are very comfortable, although if you have a hgh arch these may not be the shoe for you. I am used to a higher arch and these seem fairly flat bottomed. ive been wearing them for two weeks now and even though they lack the arch I am accustomed too, they are still very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the size
customer_reviews.text: Keens used to be a shoe that fit wider feet naturally. That is not the case with these. I would recommend one size up if you are operating on previous expectations. Good quality, good shoes. Keep in mind the size and these are great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gorton

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a good shoe. My advice would be to buy them a little large. If you go between 2 sizes go with the larger size. I go between sizes 11.5 and 12 and I went with 12 and they fit well. The sizing tool they have works well, but I did not agree with their recommendation of 11.5.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Run small but comfortable enough
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these shoes are ok. They run about a half size small compared to other Keens. 11 is usually almost too long so I’m still ok in an 11 with these but they require thin socks to work. It’s also impossible to get them snug. The laces stop too far down to be able to get them appropriately tight so they end up feeling like slip on shoes that are a bit loose. For a casual shoe, it’s not a deal killer but if you plan to hike in them it could be trouble. They are incredibly warm. Nice since I have to wear this socks but they are not going to be wearable in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Still

customer_reviews.title: I like them a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like them a lot, but the pictures seem to pretty clearly show an army/flat green suede against brown leather that I really admired, the pair I received is absolutely brown on brown, no green hue at all.
customer_reviews.author: ProjectPair

customer_reviews.title: Coomfortable and not bulky
customer_reviews.text: Create water proof shoe. If been look for a slim comfortable pair. In fact I'd tried 3 or 4 pairs (kept sending them back) before settling on these Keens. There not bulky, there comfortable and keep my foot dry. I wanted a slip on shoe, so I bought Hickies to put on them...works great.
customer_reviews.author: Spear

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT shoes! Fit wide
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT shoes! Fit wide, which is perfect for me! VERY comfortable and have worn well (this is my second pair) They hold up well to lots of walking, and look great! Tread is good for just about anywhere you would walk... not hikers, just great street shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Joel J.

customer_reviews.title: KEEN Men's Citizen Low WP Shoe, Magnet/Black, 12 M
customer_reviews.text: Thank you! The order arrived on time and in good condition. Excellent! I am size 11 and 1/2. I ordered a size 12. (I am familiar enough with Keen shoes & boots to order up 1/2 inch in my normal size. They typically run a little small in the length).Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Must have been a filter
customer_reviews.text: I like Keen but this style looks way better online that it does in person. These badboys are pretty funky looking and on the lower end of the cool spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: One size doesn't always fit all
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of keens and they are awesome, comfortable right out of the box, however with this particular model I had read reviews of them being a bit small. I wear a 10.5 in all my other keens so I ordered a size 11 and they fit great. Only 4 stars because I understand that there can be size variation between different brands but one brand size should be the same for all their models
customer_reviews.author: Seth Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Better Keens exist, but this one is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy every day shoe. Fits great and true wide. The only downside is the top front panel above the toe protector is more of a sued leather and is prone to scuffing. But it's still structurally sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Agey

customer_reviews.title: Nice shore. I liked the look and style it ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shore. I liked the look and style it was just a little on the small side and I had to return them. I'm right between a 9.5 and 10 and it's always somewhat of a guess when I order online. I always buy clothing that has the free returns options because of situations like this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig O

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in sizing
customer_reviews.text: Like most Keen shoes, they appear to be very well made. My feet are between 9 and 9 1/2. I have never worn a size 10 and have never gotten a size up, but I should have with these.
customer_reviews.author: Dux

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, but that is what I like about Keen
customer_reviews.author: Photoguy

customer_reviews.title: Water proof is worth and it and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I have never worn a pair of Keens I didn't like. This one is no exception. I also love the fact that these are water proof. This last winter, a co-worker and I both went to our cars in the middle of a blizzard. Our parking lot hadn't been plowed in hours. Snow was super deep. About an hour later he asked if my socks were soaked, cuz his were. My feet were dry as a bone. Also love how comfortable they are.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are very light weight and offer little to no support
customer_reviews.text: I thought the Keen brand meant quality. These are not well made shoes. I bought them, I wore them., I gave them away.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstonia

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first pair for a hole developed on the right side near the tie of the left shoe, the very same thing happened with the replacement pair within weeks. Other than that they are comfortable but who wants to pay for shoes with a hole in them?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: Toes on outside of shoe do NOT match. Sad. 😟
customer_reviews.text: I have Several pairs of your shoes. No more. It looks like you sent me two shoes same size that are not the same. I love your shoes. No more. Quality looks like the were made in China on a discount. Sad in Boerne Texas you used to have quality. I assume that is no longer important. ADIÓS 👋
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Niederhauser

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes. Unfortunately they are significantly shorter than standard ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. Unfortunately they are significantly shorter than standard for size 10. My toes are against the front of the shoe. I’ve been wearing size 10 for 50 years and this is nothing I’ve dealt with before.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: New shoe
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Light weight and well constructed. Based on other reviews I ordered a half size bigger and the fit is just right with my toes just barely touching the end. My only complaint is that the laces are absurdly long and will need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bertoli

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as comfortable as my other pair of Keens
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are ok. Not quite as comfortable as my other pair of Keens, but not the same style so time will tell on how they do. Definitely order a size up. I wear an 11 and ordered a 12 and they are none too big. I went a size up from experience from my last pair of Keens.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: This was not true to size I am a ten and it fit like a 9and a half buy a half size bigger
customer_reviews.author: Coquille

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoe. I should have bought a 1/2 size bigger Pros: Nice looking shoe Cons: Fits is somewhat small, especially width. Shoe laces were very long. I need to get smaller shoe laces
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality shoe. Nice enough for casual wear and rugged enough for trail use. I love that it does not have a waterproof membrane but rather just waterproof full grain leather which makes the shoe much more breathable and waterproof enough for all but the most demanding conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Iafrate

customer_reviews.title: order larger sizes
customer_reviews.text: Keens are strange, many times they either run too big or too small depending on their shoe types. This one runs too small. I wear a 9, I got 9, but it feels like an 8 or 8.5.
customer_reviews.author: C. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Stylish but tight
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for husband who is extremely picky. He liked them but I would recommend going half size larger
customer_reviews.author: Bussssy Mon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Size up a half size! Other than that, these shoes are amazing. I've been abusing them on hiking trails and on my mountain bike, and they seem to like it. Tons of grip, waterproof obviously, and the keep your toes warm. Another winner from Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Five stars from a picky middle-schooler
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son, who has giant feet and outgrows his shoes in moments. He also has average heels but slightly wide toes, so the Keen shoes fit him particularly well. He loves these, he thinks they look great, they're comfortable, and they're more waterproof than his sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: I pay attention

customer_reviews.title: Shoe sizes vary from left to right
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a half size larger to ensure the shoes would fit but the right shoe is still too small. These don't fit like other Keen shoes. Too bad. Have to send back.
customer_reviews.author: S Dugan

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful Shoe Design and Color
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully designed shoe and fits well when you figure out your size. I wear a size 9 shoe and had to buy a 10. Keens usually run small.
customer_reviews.author: Ole-Dun

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are a great value. I want to chime in on the ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a great value. I want to chime in on the sizing debate. I have narrow feet, I also own two other pairs of Keens that are both size 10, but for some reason on this shoe I had to go to a size 10.5 us. The exchange was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Iwanttolovethis

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy.
customer_reviews.text: Another great pair of shoes from Keen. Well made, quality materials, and that great Keen fit. That's why I keep coming back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Corlis

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 size too small.
customer_reviews.text: Quality, but 1/2 size too small. I wear size 10, and every other pair of keen shoes I've purchased were sized correctly, but this pair was a little small. The width is good, so I'll still wear them, but not as my primary pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: David C Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Love Keens wide toe box
customer_reviews.text: Love the style. Love the fit. Heavier than I like though
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Lowry

customer_reviews.title: was so disappointed that they were too small
customer_reviews.text: was so disappointed that they were too small. Went to order 1/2 size larger and the price went from $58 to $119 in 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: i like the shoe
customer_reviews.text: i like the shoe, it looks good and feels good... but they are a bit too compact... meaning they hug your feet comfortably, but after a while, you will feel a somewhat claustrophobic...
customer_reviews.author: ShauntK

customer_reviews.title: They fit and other than the imperfection I really liked them.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were used and the trademark toe wrap on the Keen shoe was seperated from the leather. They fit and other than the imperfection I really liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Need 1/2 size Larger
customer_reviews.text: Have multiple pairs of Keen shoes all size 11US. This pair 11 was too small, had to go tok a 11.5 US. Other than that I like them a lot. Rugged style that is dressier then sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an 11-1/2 in these since that is my normal size. They are just a bit too short so I was going to return them for a 12. Then I saw the $30 price increase to go from an 11-1/2 to a 12. I decided to keep them and deal with the shorter length.
customer_reviews.author: David Hulsmeyer

customer_reviews.title: High arches
customer_reviews.text: Arch are very high makes me feel like I am walking on the outsides of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Another Keen Winner
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my partner. We've both bought Keen shoes before and LOVE them. This is a really nice slip on. It goes with so many different styles. And they're very comfortable, like all Keen shoes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Skiles

customer_reviews.title: good shoes
customer_reviews.text: love that they are waterproof, and they did stretch out enough to fit well
customer_reviews.author: philip white

customer_reviews.title: It is a good show but it doesn't fit my feet
customer_reviews.text: It is a good show but it doesn't fit my feet. You should buy these shoes in person to obtain an accurate fit.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Asplundh

customer_reviews.title: Keen makes great shoes
customer_reviews.text: No break in time need. They came in the mail I put them on and it felt like I had owned them for years.’super comfortable shoes. They are true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keen is my favorite brand of shoes
customer_reviews.text: Keen is my favorite brand of shoes. Because of my wide feet I often buy men's shoes two sizes smaller than my size. Keen has never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy A Berg

customer_reviews.title: Good online shopping experience
customer_reviews.text: Fit a little bit small but will fit well after a few days of breaking in. Got here on time! Good online shopping experience.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Roberts

customer_reviews.title: They're 58" laces and they need to be more like 45" inch laces
customer_reviews.text: The shoelaces that came with the shoe are WAY too long. They're 58" laces and they need to be more like 45" inch laces. Even when I double tie them they're too long. Must be a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Lee

customer_reviews.title: Irritating Seam
customer_reviews.text: I loved the shoe, but there was an irritating seam along the top of my foot that was very uncomfortable. So I returned it, because the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Hollang

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect information
customer_reviews.text: The product said made in USA but received found Thailand. Already returned for refund but need USD 26 through post office to catch the return deadline. Not sure it can be fully refund or not.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Chik

customer_reviews.title: they performed great in the rain and as a light hiker
customer_reviews.text: I own and wear 6 pairs of Keens in 10.5. This is the only pair I needed an 11, I think the shape of the toe box is just slightly angled enough to let my long 3rd toe to rub. Wore these on a trip to Ireland , they performed great in the rain and as a light hiker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zwior

customer_reviews.title: I love KEEN shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love KEEN shoes! But this pair is not my fav. I ordered my regular size and they ran a little small, so order a half size larger than usual. And if like shoe laces, this shoe is for you. They could shorten the laces by about 12' and still have enough to work with. Not much arch support, I added a pair of inserts. It's an awesome looking shoe, but when I wear these out I'll look something else.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Deneys

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe love it now that I found the correct
customer_reviews.text: I normally take a size 11 in all other shoes. had to send back and got an11.5 to fit properly. Great shoe love it now that I found the correct size
customer_reviews.author: EOB

customer_reviews.title: Dang nice shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Dang nice fit. These shoes work very well with my prosthetic leg. I have never tried this brand before and I like them. They walk evenly and track nice. Good job KEEN and thank you for a fine shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pegleg

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: This show does not fit like a 13. I’m pretty sure I would have to order a 14 for this shoe to fit well.
customer_reviews.author: G. N. AKINS

customer_reviews.title: A fine shoe for casual work
customer_reviews.text: A fine shoe for casual work. laces were super long so I had to buy some shorter ones. Not as supportive as the Targhee, but expected that.
customer_reviews.author: clc

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size. Too narrow. Had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not true to size. Too narrow. Had to wear so could not return, or would have. If you are used to other Keen leather shoes, this is significantly smaller. Made my feet hurt.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoe but ..
customer_reviews.text: The shoe feels well made but the angle padding rubs against me. I returned it because of that.
customer_reviews.author: nerdie

customer_reviews.title: I love all my Keen shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love all my Keen shoes, but this pair is the most squeaky pair of shoes I have ever owned. To the point where I'm embarrassed to even wear them. I should have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit was not the Keen I've know in the past. Very narrow and not very supportive. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Osswald

customer_reviews.title: Other then the size all else (shipping and arrival time) was good
customer_reviews.text: Using for everyday, the shoe is slightly tight at the toe I got my size 10 1/2. I guess in this shoe I needed a half size bigger. I can live with it
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are a little narrower than my other Keens and have more of a sneaker look, but i like them. They are nice shoes though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, runs large.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for work shoes, and didn't even walk 15' before taking them off. Ordered a size 9 (my shoe size), and it was too large. Returned them a day later. Easy return, though, so can't complain about that.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: but these are not great, feel cheap and thin
customer_reviews.text: I am usually a huge keen fan, but these are not great, feel cheap and thin, can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HollyB

customer_reviews.title: As most buyers lament, the shoe is sized a ...
customer_reviews.text: As most buyers lament, the shoe is sized a little small. Had to exchange it for a half size larger than normal.
customer_reviews.author: This Is Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Keen shoes! They fit as expected and are extremely comfortable. I highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Brucker

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, order bigger
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes, however need to order a size bigger then you expect. I wear size 10 Keens, but needed to order an 11. Excellent customer service as usual.
customer_reviews.author: James Chatfield

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoe and weatherproof with regular care
customer_reviews.text: Laces way too long! Great comfortable shoe and weatherproof with regular care products
customer_reviews.author: J & L Kerr

customer_reviews.title: I love Keen shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Typical Keen shoes, their exceptional with fit and comfort. My only complaint is on this particular shoe the laces are extremely long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's 1015131 Hiking Shoe
feature_bullets: Low-profile hiking shoe featuring waterproof premium-leather upper with front and back pull loops
